page.title: 18R.A.F. WOODBRIDGE (U.S.A.F.)
page.content: R.A.F. Woodbridge air base occupies a large part of this area. It was cons- tructed during World War 2, in July 1942,as a recovery base for distressed British and Allied aircraft. The Uni- ted States Air Force have had admini- strative control since 1952. Currently based here are the 67th Aerospace Rescue and Recovery Squadron, which flies the HC-130 and HH-53 helicopters known s the "Jolly Green Giants", and the 78th and 91st Tactical Fighter Squadrons, both flying the A10 anti-tank fighter aircraft. The three squadrons form part of the 81st Tac- tical Fighter Wing whose home is jointly here at RAF Woodbridge and at nearby RAF Bentwaters. The 81st's total military complement is around 5000, some 1200 of whom are based at RAF Woodbridge.
